intro: Micropholis cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf micropholis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is often smooth and may exude a milky sap when damaged. Micropholis cuneata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
